Purpose- 
The use of physiological parameters that requires the use of instrumention.
Measuring a pulse rate that requires using a time device and important 
to become familiar with first lab with "tools of the trade''. Also , learn 
the involvement of the measurment in chemical and physical paramaters.
It involves these measurments that are Chemical determination which are 
indicators that change colors with different chemical conditions and with 
specific ion meters and pH . The other one is physical determinations: 
Thermometers that measures thermal energy of temperture by electronic 
means ordisplacement of mercury. Sethoscopes are instruments that 
monitor internal energy by auditory. sphygmomanometers measure blood 
presssure changes by displacement of mercury, springs, or electronic
means. Spirometers and pneumographs- that measures volume changes of 
thorax relating to ventilation and air exchange. Electronic instruments-
monitors and display a biologica phenomena.

Procedures-
1-A: Demystifying the black box
step 1: Observe these Instrumenta
-Biological event
-Input transducer or electrode
-Amplifier
-Output transducer(Display)
Step 2 make a effort to reconize or indentify these insturments on sight.
Step 3 to understand the "black box" instrument for this experiment and 
measurment of physiological events.

1-B: Units of measure
Step 1- familiarize the basic of meater unita of measure.
Step 2- learn the basic of each unit measurments.
Step 3- Learn the signinificance of the prefex of each unit.
Step 4- finish worksheet on oage 6 with following information given.

Results-
- using basic multiplicatin and division to aolve these problem on page 6 
and 7. Time measurements was used with a 'black box' to measure your pulse
 per seconds/ minutes and solving by multiply the second by 4 to get beats
    per minute. 
  -  pH measurments used 3 container of liquid to get pH by observing the 
strips. 
- switching to mm to cm
28.1mm to 2810cm 
-mass measurment 
107.27*1000= 107,270

Discussion- 
the only limitation was actually using the 'black box' during the 
experiment and personally using/ familarizing it. most of this experiment 
was on electronic and understanding of each componets being used.

Conlusion-
Throughout the lab 1 it was mostly understanding the metric system and 
convert to different metric system. Visualize when the metric system needs
to be used. Also recognize the 'black box' and using electronic 
instruments and familarize each electronic piece that is being used 
in the lab. Also, understanding the hydrogen ion concentration of 
acidity and alkalinity of a solution of pH. During the lab different items 
were provided such as graduated cylinder and beaker to measure the mass
volume.
